content: The suits arose from comments linking Sanatan Sanstha and its members to the murders of a scribe and rationalists

title: Kamareddy floods: Homes, hopes and harvests swept away in deluge of a lifetime
content: The Ganesh Chaturthi festival brought not cheer but chaos as record rains turned Kamareddy into a disaster zone. Colonies were submerged, vehicles washed away, crops destroyed and hundreds forced to seek shelter on rooftops and relief camps. In three days, the district received 39.98 cm of rainfall ‚Äî 40.7% of its annual average. P. Laxma Reddy reports from the worst-hit areas

title: High Court suspends life sentence of Satlok Ashram head Rampal in disciples' death case
content: In 2018, the head of Satlok Ashram and some followers were held guilty in two separate cases related to murder, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy registered against them

title: Too many students, too few teachers in Karnataka
content: A whopping 85,495¬†teaching posts are vacant across government-run educational institutions in Karnataka, with guest faculty making up for them. On Teachers‚Äô Day, Jayanth R. looks at its debilitating impact on quality of education

title: Himachal rain fury: Landslip in Kullu leaves 1 dead, 6 buried
content: A total of 1,212 roads are closed in Himachal Pradesh, of which 289 were blocked in Mandi, 231 in Kullu, 211 in Shimla, 192 in Chamba district

title: Following adverse weather, four radars to be set up in J&K
content: Well-positioned radars are useful in improving the lead time in warning of sudden changes in weather that can bring intense rainfall

title: Govt. has put in place a robust mechanism for urea supply, says Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu
content: The State government has been able to get higher allocation of urea from the Centre due to the initiative taken by the Chief Minister, he says

title: GST reforms foster business-friendly environment, say trade bodies
content: Reduction in rates on essential goods helps consumers and businesses alike, besides easing the burden on households and improving affordability, they observe

title: Rampant development, not climate, pushing Himalaya to the edge
content: Disasters in August and September are exposing the steep cost of ignoring climate risks in the rush for development in the Hindu Kush Himalaya, experts say

title: TDP welcomes Centre‚Äôs decision to rationalise GST, reduce levies
content: These reforms will not only reduce household expenditure but also stimulate consumption, domestic market and attract investment, says the TDP State president

content: It will discuss creation of three integrated theatre commands, lessons from Operation Sindoor, and review progress in indigenous defence manufacturing

Photo identity cards shall be provided by the Manipur Police, it says; agreement to be followed by a ‚Äòtripartite dialogue for a negotiated political settlement under Constitution of India‚Äô¬†

content: The project has a corridor length of 27.9 km, with 14 stations, from Poonamallee to Sunguvarchatram. Of the total ‚Çπ2,126 crore allotted for the project, ‚Çπ1,836 crore has been assigned for land acquisition

title: After Supreme Court caution, Centre says talks on with States for special NIA courts
content: Supreme Court had earlier told govt that NIA undertrials cannot remain in jail indefinitely and have to be released on bail if exclusive courts are not set up for speedy trial

content: The new GST regime would cause State¬†an additional loss of ‚Çπ15,000 crore per year: Krishna Byre Gowda

title: NITI Aayog recommends multiple strategies to enhance pulses production
content: ‚ÄúThe role of pulses in ensuring food security, nutritional well-being, and sustainable agriculture with significant environmental benefits is very critical,‚Äù says report

title: Transgender children, senior citizens need special shelter homes: NHRC
content: Garima Greh shelters currently provide residential support for transgender people between the ages of 18 and 60 only; funding delays, inexperienced staff, insufficient food hamper shelters, says NHRC

title: Mamata wants other parties to occupy Opposition benches in West Bengal, not the BJP
content: The BJP is the principal Opposition party in the Assembly; the Left parties and the Congress have no representation in the House

title: Auto, pharma sectors hail GST changes; airlines feel their wings clipped
content: Auto-makers expect the tax cut to boost demand; airlines slam higher GST on non-economy seats; small entrepreneurs worried about higher labour costs; textile industry disappointed over the 18% duty for garments priced above ‚Çπ2,500

title: Carter sorry for spitting on Prescott: 'A mistake'
content: Eagles defensive tackle Jalen Carter was ejected from Thursday night's season-opening win before the first play from scrimmage for spitting on Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott.

title: 'Disappointed' Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: Ballmer: Clips 'always done right thing' with Kawhi
content: Clippers owner Steve Ballmer told ESPN that he would "want the league to investigate" if another owner and another team were accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap, as the Clippers were in a podcast by Pablo Torre on Wednesday.

title: 49ers add McCaffrey to injury report with calf issue
content: Running back Christian McCaffrey was added to the San Francisco 49ers' injury report Thursday night because of a calf issue.

title: Sources: North Carolina, Belichick ban Pats staff
content: North Carolina and first-year head coach Bill Belichick have banned the New England Patriots' staff from accessing the Tar Heels' program, sources told ESPN.

title: Valkyries make WNBA history with playoff debut
content: The Golden State Valkyries became the first WNBA team to reach the playoffs in its inaugural season when they defeated the Dallas Wings on Thursday.

title: Tyson, Mayweather Jr. to compete in exhibition
content: Boxing legends Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr. agreed to compete in an exhibition boxing match next spring, with details to be determined at a later date.

content: The distinctive design will be paired with a sleek all-black uniform and pays homage to Idaho's deep connection to the potato industry.

content: Here's a look at the Week 1 uniforms for all 32 NFL teams, led by the Saints debuting their gold uniforms.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: Roundabouts, sheepherding, hot sauce: USWNT stars in England
content: Adapting to a new life in a new country is tough, but these USWNT stars have had some fun this summer.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can the Fighting Nerds keep rolling at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night: Imavov vs. Borralho? Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks and betting insider Ian Parker gives his best bets.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ men's college basketball teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: 400kg RDX, 14 Pak terrorists: Mumbai on alert; Lashkar-e-Jihadi warns of 34 'human bombs'
content: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

title: GST 2.0: Full comprehensive list of items with revised rates
content: New GST rates 2025 full list: The Finance Minister announced significant GST rate cuts and slab changes, effective September 22, 2025, leading to cheaper daily-use items. Many food items will attract 0% GST, and life and health insurance will also see zero tax. The government is monitoring price changes, while luxury and sin goods may face higher taxes, potentially reaching a 40% bracket.

title: From plush to slush: Yamuna floodwaters swamp Noida‚Äôs luxury farmhouses
content: Rising Yamuna floodwaters have submerged luxury farmhouses along the Noida floodplain, reviving memories of last year's devastating inundation. Caretakers are evacuating properties as the river approaches record levels, impacting over 1,000 farmhouses with lavish amenities.

title: Maharashtra minister becomes 1st Tesla owner: Pratak Sarnaik takes 'Y' model home
content: Maharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik received the first Tesla Model Y in Mumbai, aiming to promote electric vehicle adoption. He intends to gift the car to his grandson, fostering early awareness of green mobility. Maharashtra is committed to EV transition with incentives and MSRTC's procurement of 5,000 e-buses, aligning with the Prime Minister's clean mobility vision.

title: Clash over 'samosas': UP man thrashed with kicks and punches by wife, in-laws
content: In Pilibhit, a domestic dispute over samosas turned violent when Shivam Kumar failed to bring them home as requested by his wife, Sangeeta. The argument escalated the next day, leading to Sangeeta, along with her parents and uncle, allegedly assaulting Shivam. Police have registered an FIR, and an investigation is underway to determine the full scope of the incident.

title: Dinner diplomacy: Trump hosts dinner for tech CEOs; gives '3-word description' for Cook & others
content: US President Donald Trump hosted tech CEOs, including Tim Cook, Satya Nadella, and Sundar Pichai, at the White House, calling them a "high IQ group." Discussions centered on AI, with Pichai praising the administration's 'AI Action Plan.' Google pledged a $250 billion US investment, while Microsoft invests $75-$80 billion annually.

title: 'Phone call' halts mining crackdown: Trouble for Ajit Pawar over ‚Äòthreat‚Äô to cop?
content: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar faces accusations of obstructing IPS officer Anjana Krishna's efforts to curb illegal sand mining in Solapur. A video circulating online purportedly captures Pawar instructing Krishna to halt action against an NCP member involved. Opposition leaders are demanding an apology, alleging Pawar threatened the officer after she insisted on verifying his identity.

title: Happy teachers' day: Top 50 wishes, messages to share with your teachers
content: India celebrates Teachers' Day on September 5th, commemorating Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan's birth anniversary. This day honors teachers' profound impact, shaping students' minds, character, and futures. From academic guidance to life lessons, teachers inspire and empower. Heartfelt wishes, messages of gratitude, and inspirational quotes are shared to express appreciation for their dedication and influence, recognizing their role as mentors and guides.

title: Joe Biden undergoes skin cancer surgery, fresh videos show head wound - watch
content: Ex-US President, Joe Biden, was recently spotted with a visible mark on his head. Reports confirm that the 82-year-old underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer treatment. Biden was seen leaving a church in Rehoboth Beach with a bandage. Earlier, he was seen wearing a cap to conceal the wound. In May, aides disclosed Biden's diagnosis of Stage 4 prostate cancer. Biden shared a message about strength in difficult times.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.

title: ‚ÄòWill restore Amma‚Äôs rule‚Äô: Sasikala rakes up AIADMK unity debate; signals political comeback
content: VK Sasikala has reignited the AIADMK leadership debate, asserting the party's need for unity to challenge the DMK in the 2026 elections. Senior leader K A Sengottaiyan supports Sasikala, urging EPS to reconcile with former members.

title: NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad ranks first again in management, check top 10 here
content: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top spot in the NIRF 2025 management institute rankings for the sixth consecutive year. IIM Bangalore and IIM Kozhikode follow closely behind. While IIMs dominate, non-IIMs like IIT Delhi's DMS, MDI Gurgaon, and XLRI Jamshedpur also feature in the top 10, showcasing a diverse range of quality management education options in India.

title: Who is Mitesh Khapra? The IIT Madras professor featured in TIME Magazine
content: Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras professor, features in TIME's 2025 AI 100 list. He is recognised for NLP and machine learning contributions. Khapra focuses on AI systems for India's diverse languages. His work addresses challenges in English-centric AI models. He aims to make AI accessible across India. AI4Bharat, his project, builds datasets for Indian languages. This initiative supports government's Bhashini mission.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
content: Amazon is monitoring employee phone usage. Workers must now report the percentage of work-related use on company phones. Reimbursements will be adjusted accordingly. This is part of cost-cutting measures under CEO Andy Jassy. Employees are expressing concerns about micromanagement. Amazon defends the policy as a return to its performance-driven roots. Other companies are also tightening expense policies.

title: 'Bidis and Bihar start with letter B': Congress faces heat over X post
content: The Congress's Kerala unit stirred controversy by linking a GST rate cut on bidis to Bihar, sparking outrage and accusations of mocking the state. JD(U) leader Sanjay Kumar Jha condemned the post as shameful, highlighting Bihar's historical significance and warning of electoral repercussions. The contentious remark has ignited a political firestorm ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Is it a bank holiday on September 5? Check details
content: Banks across multiple Indian states remained closed on September 5 due to Id-E-Milad and Thiruvonam, as per the RBI holiday calendar. While digital banking services continued uninterrupted, physical branch visits were necessary for certain transactions. Maharashtra, however, shifted the Eid-e-Milad holiday in Mumbai to September 8, 2025, impacting government securities and related markets.

title: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
content: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

title: 'Department of war': Why Trump wants to rename Pentagon; executive order likely today
content: President Trump is set to sign an executive order allowing the Pentagon to be referred to as the "Department of War," a secondary designation endorsed by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. Trump hinted at the change, recalling the department's historical name during World Wars. This move follows Hegseth's actions to reverse earlier policies, including reattributing Confederate-era fort names.

title: 5th death in 10 months: BITS Pilani Goa student found dead on campus
content: Rishi Nair, a 19-year-old BITS Pilani Goa student from Bengaluru, was found dead in his hostel room, marking the fifth student death in ten months. Police report Rishi was battling depression following his girlfriend's suicide. His parents had moved him to the Goa campus for support.

title: World No. 5 GM Muzychuk forgets about clock, suffers massive setback at Grand Swiss
content: The FIDE Grand Swiss witnessed a stunning upset as Hungarian teenager Zs√≥ka Ga√°l defeated world No. 5 Anna Muzychuk. Reigning world champion D Gukesh of India began strongly, defeating Etienne Bacrot, while Praggnanandhaa drew with Jeffery Xiong. In other matches, Vaishali secured a win, adding to the excitement of the tournament's opening day.

title: Series of earthquakes hit Afghanistan days after quake killed over 2,000
content: A series of earthquakes, including a 5.2 magnitude tremor, have struck Afghanistan's Hindukush region, causing widespread devastation. The quakes have resulted in over 2,200 fatalities and 3,000 injuries, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian situation worsened by recent flash floods. International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

title: Dramatic arrest in Kannauj: SP leader Kaish Khan found hiding in mattress
content: Kaish Khan, a Samajwadi Party leader and former treasurer, was apprehended in Kannauj for violating a banishment order. Authorities had instructed Khan to remain outside the district limits on July 28. Acting on a tip, Kotwali police discovered him concealed in the loft of his residence.

title: Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Built a $10 billion fashion empire
content: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer renowned for his elegant and sophisticated designs, has passed away at the age of 91. Credited with redefining modern Italian style through minimalist designs and timeless sophistication, Armani's creations graced red carpets and boardrooms alike. He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

title: Massive blast at Nagpur RDX plant: Shockwaves damaged buildings 2km away
content: A powerful explosion at Solar Defence and Aerospace Limited's RDX facility near Nagpur claimed one life and injured over 25. The blast, which occurred post-midnight, demolished the unit and sent shockwaves kilometers away. This marks the second fatal incident at the defence manufacturer in two years, raising concerns about safety lapses.

title: 'Baaghi 4' advance BO collection day 1: Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Dutt starrer makes comeback
content: Tiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4', also starring Sanjay Dutt, is poised for a strong opening, with advance bookings nearing 2 lakh tickets. The film has already grossed ‚Çπ7.4 crore in advance sales, with Maharashtra, Delhi NCR, and Gujarat leading in bookings.

title: Watch: Putin goes full Gen Z, learns what 'chill sesh' and 'total cringe' mean
content: At the Eastern Economic Forum, Vladimir Putin explored Gen Z slang while promoting regional development and Asia-Pacific cooperation. He visited the National Centre ‚ÄúRussia‚Äù and learned youth lingo translations. Beyond this lighthearted moment, Putin emphasized infrastructure projects and deeper energy cooperation, linking the Far East's growth to Russia's pivot toward Asia.

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann catches fever, skips tour of affected areas; toll 43
content: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, down with viral fever, missed accompanying Arvind Kejriwal on a tour of flood-affected areas. Kejriwal, after visiting Mann, assessed the flood situation in Sultanpur Lodhi. His visit coincides with controversy surrounding AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, accused of rape and other charges. Pathanmajra's arrest attempt sparked a political row, with allegations of revenge politics surfacing.

title: Battered North India logs its rainiest 2-week period in 14 years
content: North India experienced unprecedented rainfall between August 22 and September 4, with nearly three times the normal amount. This intense spell, the wettest in at least 14 years, triggered devastating floods in Punjab, record Yamuna levels in Delhi, and landslides in the Himalayas.

title: Superbowl recap: Philadelphia Eagles prevail over Dallas Cowboys - Key highlights
content: The Philadelphia Eagles commenced their Super Bowl defense with a hard-fought 24-20 victory over the Dallas Cowboys in a game marked by early drama and a mid-game lightning delay. Despite an early ejection and dropped passes from CeeDee Lamb, the Eagles demonstrated resilience, with Jalen Hurts leading crucial drives, securing a thrilling NFC East opener win.

title: Sheena Bora murder trial: Indrani Mukerjea's daughter Vidhie concludes deposition
content: In the Sheena Bora murder trial, Vidhie Mukerjea concluded her deposition, alleging financial misconduct by stepbrothers and drug abuse by Rahul Mukerjea. She admitted to writing a book influenced by misinformation and expressed regret over its contents. Vidhie also cited "privileged information" when questioned about a New Zealand bank account and denied knowledge of specific financial dealings involving her parents.

title: US Open 2025: Bhambri's dream run ends in semis
content: Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski of Britain triumphed over India's Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus in a thrilling US Open semifinal. After dropping the first set, the British pair rallied to win 6(2)-7, 7-6(5), 6-4. Bhambri and Venus, despite a strong tournament run including impressive victories, couldn't maintain their early lead.

title: ‚ÄòKnife on son‚Äôs neck‚Äô: Delivery boy forces Noida woman to strip, records video
content: Gaurav, a 23-year-old hairdresser and grocery delivery person, was arrested for allegedly blackmailing a Greater Noida woman. He reportedly forced her to strip at knifepoint, threatening her children, and recorded explicit content. He then harassed her for months, sharing the images with her husband and online, leading to her reporting him to the police.

title: 'No solution on battlefield': India flags Ukraine conflict at UN
content: At the UNGA, India's envoy Parvathaneni Harish urged dialogue to resolve the Ukraine conflict, emphasizing the human cost and advocating for humanitarian aid. He welcomed diplomatic efforts like the Alaska Summit and highlighted PM Modi's engagement with global leaders. Harish also addressed the conflict's global economic impact, particularly rising fuel prices.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,800; BSE Sensex crosses 81,000 mark
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday as the market continued to react positively to GST rate cute announcements. While Nifty50 was above 24,800, BSE Sensex was up almost 300 points.

title: Asia Cup: Yuvraj's advice to Gill, Abhishek: 'Don‚Äôt repeat my mistake'
content: Yuvraj Singh is encouraging young cricketers Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma to take up golf, drawing from his own experiences. He believes that incorporating golf into their routine can help them relax, reduce mental fatigue, and ultimately improve their performance on the cricket field.

title: Pickles or whisky? Pickle parcel scam to dry Bihar unmasked
content: Ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, liquor smuggling attempts are escalating. Railway Protection Force seized a 'pickle' shipment at Varanasi Junction, uncovering 283 whisky bottles destined for Patna. This follows previous incidents, including the discovery of 316 bottles on the Lucknow-Barauni Express and arrests in Gorakhpur, highlighting intensified efforts to smuggle alcohol into the dry state.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests Adani Ports and Jayaswal Neco Industries as top stock picks for September 5, 2025. NIFTY is expected to consolidate between 24,400 and 25,000. A move above 25,000 could lead to 25,250.

title: Maratha quota storm: Fadnavis dials Chhagan Bhujbal after cabinet no-show
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis reached out to Chhagan Bhujbal, addressing OBC concerns over a government resolution regarding Maratha reservations. Bhujbal, after skipping a cabinet meeting, expressed apprehension that the GR could lead to blanket reservations for Marathas via Kunbi certificates.

title: ‚ÄòDeliver Rs 500 crore or die': MP woman judge gets death threat
content: A judge in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district received a threatening letter demanding Rs 500 crore. The sender, claiming to be associated with a dacoit gang, threatened to kill Judicial Magistrate Mohini Bhadauria if the ransom wasn't paid by September 1.

title: Pillow Nebula explained: NASA uncovers four-cornered structure; Hubble captures it
content: NGC 7027, also known as the Pillow Planetary Nebula, is a bright, compact nebula located 3,000 light-years away in Cygnus. Its unique four-cornered shape, possibly caused by a central binary star system, makes it a target for scientific study and astrophotography. This nebula provides insights into stellar life cycles and the chemical enrichment of space.

title: Govt revamps GST: Rates reduced on nearly 400 goods ‚Äî Here‚Äôs how cuts will reach consumers by Sept 22
content: Following the government's GST rate reductions on numerous goods and services, Indian companies are adjusting prices to benefit consumers by September 22. FMCG firms may increase product quantity for fixed-price items. White goods companies anticipate a demand surge, while hotels offer reduced rates for check-in payments. Car dealers, however, face potential losses due to existing inventory and revised cess structures.

title: Historic! Bavuma becomes first SA captain in 27 years to achieve this rare feat
content: South Africa clinched a historic ODI series victory against England at Lord's, their first in England since 1998. Matthew Breetzke's impressive 85 propelled the Proteas to 330, securing a 5-run win. England's struggles continue, marked by four consecutive ODI losses and a concerning post-World Cup performance. The final match on September 7 offers England a chance to salvage pride.

title: NFL Week 1 Spotlight: Travis Hunter's fearless dual-role debut
content: Travis Hunter, the Jaguars' highly anticipated rookie and Heisman Trophy winner, is set to debut as a two-way player against the Carolina Panthers. Drafted No. 2 overall, Hunter will contribute as both a wide receiver and cornerback, aiming to revitalize Jacksonville's offense and bolster their defense. His versatility is expected to significantly impact the team's performance.

title: 'You can‚Äôt talk to India, China like that': Putin hits back at Trump's tariff
content: Vladimir Putin has cautioned the United States against using tariffs and sanctions to pressure India and China, emphasizing that the colonial era is over and such tactics are inappropriate. He accused the Trump administration of attempting to weaken the leadership of these nations through economic pressure, noting their historical sensitivities and strong domestic political systems.

title: WH pushes 'warrior ethos': Trump revives 'dept of war'; Hegseth gets new title
content: Donald Trump has renamed the US department of defence to the department of war. The White House stated that Trump will sign an executive order. This permits the use of the new title as a secondary name. Pete Hegseth will be known as the secretary of war. Pentagon websites and signage will also be updated. Trump mentioned the history of victory associated with the department of war.

title: Happy Onam 2025: Top 50 Wishes, Messages, and Quotes for loved ones
content: Onam, a ten-day festival celebrated in Kerala, honors the legendary King Mahabali and his prosperous reign. Families and friends unite, adorning homes with pookalams and sharing heartfelt wishes. The festival, filled with joy and gratitude, emphasizes togetherness and the importance of cherishing traditions, love, and kindness.

title: UP Police Station In-Charge Accused Of 'Digital Bribery', Screenshots Viral
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh, a rare instance of 'digital bribery' has come to the fore, with screenshots of the transactions going viral on social media.

title: Grandmother Has No Legal Entitlement To Retain Custody Of Grandchild: Court
content: The Bombay High Court has directed a woman to return custody of her five-year-old grandson to his biological parents, citing that her emotional bond with the child does not give her a superior right to his custody.

title: Who Is Anjana Krishna, IPS Officer At Centre Of Viral Phone Call With Ajit Pawar
content: An investigation into the allegations of illegal excavation for road construction in Solapur brought IPS officer Anjana Krishna at loggerheads with Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

title: "400 kg RDX, Can Kill 1 Crore": Mumbai On Alert After Bombs In Cars Message
content: Mumbai is on high alert after the police received a WhatsApp message threatening dozens of blasts as the 10-day Ganesh festival is set to culminate tomorrow.

title: Ajit Pawar's 'Threat' To IPS Officer Sparks Row, 'Normal Tone', Says BJP
content: A video of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar threatening a woman IPS officer in the middle of taking action against illegal excavation triggered a political row on Friday.

title: Air India Express Delhi-Indore Flight Makes PAN-PAN Call After Engine Fault
content: A Delhi-Indore Air India Express flight having 161 passengers on board on Friday suffered a mid-air engine fault, with the pilot making a 'PAN-PAN' call to indicate non-life-threatening emergency.

title: What Pentagon Pizza Index Showed As "Trump Is Dead" Trended On X
content: A social media trend coincided with increased activity at pizza outlets surrounding the White House and the Pentagon roughly a week ago.

title: Man Blows Out Fire From Mouth. 2 Severely Burnt In Stunt Gone Wrong In Madhya Pradesh
content: Two men sustained severe burn injuries after a fire-blowing stunt during a procession in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain went wrong.

title: "Was Eating Away My Money": UP Man Shoots Wife Dead Over Divorce Row
content: The police said the victim was demanding child support and the transfer of a farmland before agreeing to a divorce.

title: Three Or Seven? How Many Wars Has US President Trump Really Ended
content: As President Donald Trump tries to broker an end to the Russia-Ukraine war, he claimed he has ended "seven wars" in the first few months of his second presidency.

title: Joe Biden Undergoes Skin Cancer Surgery, Seen With Huge Wound On Head
content: A video of former US President Joe Biden showing what looked like a severe wound or scar across his forehead has led to concerns about his health.

title: Western Troops Deployed In Ukraine Would Be Target For Russian Army: Putin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned on Friday that any Western forces deployed to Ukraine would be a "legitimate" target for Moscow's army.

title: Knife On Child's Neck, Noida Delivery Man Forces Woman To Strip, Records Video
content: A 22-year-old delivery man has been arrested in Noida for allegedly coercing a woman to remove her clothes by holding a knife to her child's neck, making obscene videos of her, and circulating them on social media, police said on Friday.

title: Navi Mumbai Woman Robs From Sister's House, Arrested
content: A 29-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly stealing valuables worth Rs 24.42 lakh from her sister's house in Maharashtra's Thane district within eight hours of the crime, police said on Friday.

title: Team Trump Drops Biden-Era Plan To Require US Airlines To Pay Compensation For Delays
content: The Trump administration said Thursday it is abandoning a Biden-era plan that sought to require airlines to compensate stranded passengers with cash, lodging and meals for flight cancellations.

title: Congress' Post On Bihar, Bidis Sparks Row, BJP Calls It "Insult To Entire State"
content: In a now-deleted post on X, the Congress said that "Bidis and Bihar start with B" and "cannot be considered a sin anymore", referring to the GST cut on the tobacco product.

title: Carlo Acutis: A Teen Computer Whiz Who Became Millennial Saint
content: At a Catholic school in Pope Leo XIV's hometown, fifth graders read comic books about Carlo Acutis' life entitled "Digital Disciple."

title: "Crazy Talk": RFK Jr, US Senators Spar Over Covid Vaccines In Fiery Hearing
content: Robert F Kennedy Jr, head of US Health and Human Services, batted away critics who questioned his moves to restrict vaccine access during a fiery Senate hearing.

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs consider move for Man City's Nathan Ak√©
content: Tottenham are debating whether to reopen talks for Man City defender Nathan Ake. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: "my wife absolutely kills it, and hopefully, award season coming around, people make the right decision," Allen says . he says he was just so proud of his wife, actress and singer hailee Steinfeld's performance . "it was a lot of different aspects of life," Allen said in an interview .

title: Canelo, Crawford, Mayweather: Top 25 boxers of the century
content: two of the best fighters of this generation meet on sept. 13 at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas . undisputed super middleweight champion canelo Alvarez meets junior middleweight champ Terence Crawford . a list of 25 retired fighters to step into the ring has been put together by ESPN .

content: the second home game of the season will go to a commercial break before the fourth quarter begins . it has become customary that the Mizzou fans in attendance will lob F-bombs in unison at their biggest rival . the rivalry resumed in 2021, with Kansas winning the first three games .
